Authors: Maldini B.A.M.S., Maldini M.S., Prawata A.G.
Title: Apartments with Organic Architecture Approach in Cilandak South Jakarta
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Architecture Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Maldini, B.A.M.S., Architecture Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Maldini, M.S., Architecture Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prawata, A.G., Architecture Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Jakarta as the capital city of Indonesia has a high rate density of population. The citycenter, Central Jakarta has been overpopulated. The increased density continues to spread across Jakarta. A new center of activity in South Jakarta is known as the Simatupang corridor, located in Cilandakneighborhoodwith its many office building, retails, and shopping center. Therefore, there are many domiciled employees moved into or near the area, especially Japanese expatriates. Designing an apartment building as a respond to its current issues, which are the high growing need for homes, limited land area, and poor environment qualities. The design of the apartment will be based on the theory of Organic Architecture. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: apartment; Cilandak; human settlement; organic architecture
Index Keywords: Architecture; Office buildings; apartment; Apartment buildings; Cilandak; Environment quality; High rate; Human settlements; Indonesia; Land areas; Apartment houses
